intro: Alloceratium strictum, commonly known as the rigid thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant features a tall, unbranched stem with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in a dense, spherical cluster at the top of the stem. Alloceratium strictum is typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks.
